ports.name: Echo
ports.description: The Echo service is used for testing and debugging network connectivity and software by sending back the data it receives, mirroring the original message.

ports.name: FTP-data
ports.description: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is used for transferring files between a client and a server, and this port handles data transfer in the FTP protocol.

ports.name: FTP
ports.description: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is used for transferring files between a client and a server, allowing for both file uploads and downloads.

ports.name: SSH
ports.description: SSH (Secure Shell) is used for secure remote administration of servers and for encrypted communication between a client and a server.

ports.name: Telnet
ports.description: Telnet is an older protocol used for remote administration of systems over a network, though it transmits data in plain text and is considered insecure.

ports.name: SMTP
ports.description: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used for sending email messages between mail servers.

ports.name: DNS
ports.description: DNS (Domain Name System) is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, enabling users to access websites using human-readable names.

ports.name: TFTP
ports.description: TFTP (Trivial File Transfer Protocol) is a simple file transfer protocol used for transferring files, often used for bootstrapping devices in a network.

ports.name: HTTP
ports.description: HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) is used for transmitting web pages and data over the internet. It is the foundation of data communication on the World Wide Web.

ports.name: Kerberos
ports.description: Kerberos is a network authentication protocol used to securely authenticate users and services in a distributed network environment.

ports.name: MS RPC
ports.description: MS RPC (Microsoft Remote Procedure Call) is a protocol used for communication between applications on different computers in a network.

ports.name: POP3
ports.description: POP3 (Post Office Protocol 3) is used by email clients to retrieve emails from a mail server. It downloads messages for offline reading.

ports.name: RPCbind
ports.description: Used for mapping remote procedure call (RPC) services to ports, commonly targeted in exploitation attempts.

ports.name: MS DCOM
ports.description: MS DCOM (Microsoft Distributed Component Object Model) is used to allow software components to communicate over a network.

ports.name: NetBIOS Name Service
ports.description: NetBIOS Name Service is used for name resolution on local area networks (LANs) to associate IP addresses with NetBIOS names.

ports.name: NetBIOS Session Service
ports.description: NetBIOS Session Service enables communication between systems on a local network using the NetBIOS protocol.

ports.name: IMAP
ports.description: IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol) is used for retrieving and managing email messages from a server, allowing access from multiple devices.

ports.name: HP Data Protector
ports.description: HP Data Protector is a backup and recovery software used to protect data by managing backup jobs and data storage.

ports.name: HP Data Protector
ports.description: HP Data Protector's auxiliary service used for managing specific operations and data interactions within the software.

ports.name: HTTPS
ports.description: HTTPS (HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure) is used for secure web traffic, providing SSL/TLS encryption to protect user data on the web.

ports.name: SMB
ports.description: Used for file sharing and networked printing. Frequently targeted in attacks like EternalBlue and SMB relay.

ports.name: Kerberos Change/Set Password
ports.description: Used by Kerberos for changing or setting user passwords securely in an authenticated network environment.

ports.name: SMTPS
ports.description: SMTPS (Secure SMTP) is the secure version of SMTP, using SSL/TLS to encrypt email transmission.

ports.name: Syslog
ports.description: Syslog is used for sending log messages between devices, typically for centralized logging.

ports.name: SMTP (Secure)
ports.description: SMTP with STARTTLS is used for secure sending of email messages over the internet, typically for email client communication.

ports.name: HTTP RPC Ep Map
ports.description: RPC Endpoint Mapper for managing remote procedure calls via HTTP, used by Microsoft services.

ports.name: LDAPS
ports.description: LDAPS (LDAP over SSL) is a protocol for secure directory services over a network using SSL encryption.

ports.name: IPP
ports.description: IPP (Internet Printing Protocol) is used for printing documents over a network.

ports.name: Microsoft RPC
ports.description: Microsoft RPC (Remote Procedure Call) service used for communication between applications and servers in a Windows environment.

ports.name: VMware Server
ports.description: Used by VMware server software for communication and management of virtual machines.

ports.name: FTPS Data
ports.description: FTPS (File Transfer Protocol Secure) for encrypted data transfer in the FTP protocol.

ports.name: FTPS
ports.description: FTPS (File Transfer Protocol Secure) is a secure extension to FTP that adds SSL/TLS encryption for secure file transfers.

ports.name: IMAPS
ports.description: IMAPS (Internet Message Access Protocol Secure) is the secure version of IMAP that uses SSL/TLS encryption to protect email data.

ports.name: POP3S
ports.description: POP3S (Post Office Protocol 3 Secure) is the secure version of POP3, using SSL/TLS encryption for secure email retrieval.

ports.name: Network File System
ports.description: Used for file sharing and remote access to file systems across a network.

ports.name: OpenVPN
ports.description: OpenVPN is used for secure point-to-point or site-to-site connections in virtual private networks (VPN).

ports.name: Leetspeak
ports.description: This is a port often associated with informal internet culture, notably 'leet' or '1337' speak, but it may be used for various purposes.

ports.name: Microsoft SQL Server
ports.description: Used for communication with Microsoft SQL Server, a relational database management system.

ports.name: Cisco VQP
ports.description: It allows end-devices on LANs to be authenticated via their MAC address and an appropriate VLAN attributed to the port, using a VLAN Management Policy Server (VMPS)

ports.name: SMB Direct
ports.description: SMB Direct is used for fast file sharing and communication over a network using the SMB protocol.

ports.name: cPanel
ports.description: Used by cPanel, a web hosting control panel, to manage website hosting accounts and services.

ports.name: cPanel (Secure)
ports.description: The secure version of the cPanel port for managing hosting services over SSL encryption.

ports.name: Oracle DB
ports.description: Oracle database service for communication with database management systems over a network.

ports.name: Oracle DB Secure
ports.description: The secure version of the Oracle database service, using SSL encryption for secure communication.

ports.name: Fax over IP
ports.description: Used for transmitting fax signals over an IP network, enabling the transmission of fax data without traditional telephone lines.

ports.name: Xbox Live
ports.description: Used for communication in the Xbox Live network for online gaming and services.

ports.name: MySQL
ports.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system, using this port for communication with databases.

ports.name: RDP
ports.description: RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) allows for remote desktop access to a computer running Windows.

ports.name: Blizzard Game
ports.description: Used by Blizzard Entertainment games like World of Warcraft for server communication.

ports.name: Oracle DB Listener/Metasploit
ports.description: Used by Oracle Database for handling incoming database connection requests.

ports.name: Exceed
ports.description: Exceed is a software used for remote access to graphical applications over a network.

ports.name: PostgreSQL
ports.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful open-source relational database management system that uses this port for database communication.

ports.name: Python SimpleHTTPServer
ports.description: Used by Python's SimpleHTTPServer module for serving HTTP requests, typically for local testing and development.

ports.name: VNC
ports.description: VNC (Virtual Network Computing) allows remote access to a desktop environment over the network.

ports.name: IRC
ports.description: Commonly used for botnet communication in DDoS attacks. Often targeted by attackers using IRC protocols.

ports.name: IRC
ports.description: IRC (Internet Relay Chat) used for online text communication and messaging over a network.

ports.name: XChat IRC
ports.description: Used for IRC communication, often exploited by attackers for command and control (C&C) communication.

ports.name: IRC
ports.description: Another commonly used IRC (Internet Relay Chat) server port for online messaging.

ports.name: BitTorrent
ports.description: BitTorrent is a peer-to-peer file sharing protocol for distributing data over the internet.

ports.name: Yahoo Messenger
ports.description: Used for communication in the Yahoo Messenger instant messaging platform.

ports.name: SIP
ports.description: SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) is used for establishing and managing voice, video, and messaging communication.

ports.name: HTTP Alt
ports.description: Used for running HTTP services on alternate ports, commonly used for development and testing purposes.

ports.name: MongoDB
ports.description: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that uses this port for communication with its database service, typically for managing data storage and retrieval in web applications.

ports.name: cPanel (Admin)
ports.description: Used for secure administrative access to cPanel services and management.

ports.name: Splunk Web
ports.description: Used by Splunk for web-based interaction with the Splunk platform, typically for managing logs and system monitoring.

ports.name: vSphere Web Client
ports.description: Used by VMware vSphere Web Client for managing VMware ESXi servers and virtual machines.

ports.name: PHP-FPM
ports.description: PHP-FPM is a PHP FastCGI Process Manager used for handling web traffic that involves PHP scripting.

ports.name: Tor
ports.description: Tor (The Onion Router) is used for anonymous communication over the internet.

ports.name: JetDirect
ports.description: Used for printing services, especially for HP printers over a network.

ports.name: Webmin
ports.description: Webmin is a web-based interface used for system administration and server management.

ports.name: Zabbix Agent
ports.description: Zabbix Agent is used by the Zabbix monitoring system for remote monitoring of servers and devices.

ports.name: NetBus
ports.description: NetBus is a trojan horse malware that allows remote control of an infected system.

ports.name: Sub 7
ports.description: Sub 7 is another trojan horse malware that provides remote control access to an infected system.

ports.name: Back Orifice
ports.description: Back Orifice is a notorious remote access trojan (RAT) used for unauthorized control of infected systems.
